title: Consumer Cos Up As LVMH Offer Boosts Tiffany — Consumer Roundup
text:
Shares of retailers and other consumer-services companies rose after a big deal in the luxury segment of retail.

Tiffany & Co. rallied after LVMH Moet Hennessy Louis Vuitton offered to buy the high-end jeweler for $120 a share, or close to $14.5 billion.

Shares of other luxury brands, such as Britain's Burberry, rose in sympathy.

Restaurant Brands International shares fell as weakness in its Canadian Tim Hortons chain offset robust sales growth at its fried-chicken Popeyes brand, where it hopes to launch a new version of the popular spicy chicken sandwich on Nov. 3.
